userRequest: AI startup in SF with 5 employees

actions.name: create_user
actions.visibilityRule: User creation is a global event; visibility is not space-scoped.

actions.name: create_workspace
actions.description: Create a new workspace (organizational container for channels).
actions.visibilityRule: Workspace creation is a global event; no workspace membership table exists in schema.

actions.name: create_channel
actions.description: Create a new channel that can later have members and messages.
actions.visibilityRule: Channel creation is global; membership determines later in-channel content visibility.

actions.name: add_channel_member
actions.description: Add a user as a member of a channel.
actions.visibilityRule: Membership records determine who can see channel content; visible to channel members.

actions.name: post_message
actions.description: Post a new root message in a channel (starts a new thread implicitly).
actions.visibilityRule: Channel messages are visible to channel members.

actions.name: reply_to_message
actions.description: Reply to an existing message (threaded reply within the same channel).
actions.visibilityRule: Replies are visible to channel members (same channel as the parent message).

actions.name: react_to_message
actions.description: Add an emoji reaction to a message.
actions.visibilityRule: Reactions are visible to the same audience as the message: channel members.

actions.name: share_channel_to_workspace
actions.description: Associate a channel with a workspace (akin to sharing/connecting the channel to that workspace).
actions.visibilityRule: Channel-to-workspace association is a global linking event in this schema (no workspace membership table present).

derived.computeRule: Threads are derived from chat rows: each root chat row (parent_id is null) creates a thread whose id is that root chat.id; replies have parent_id pointing to that root and belong to the same thread.

agents.name: Maya Chen
agents.systemPrompt: Role: Co-founder & CEO. Personality: visionary, candid, empathetic, and high-urgency. Behavior: sets clear priorities, aligns the team on milestones, and balances long-term vision with near-term execution. Drives focus, asks for crisp status updates, and cuts scope when needed to hit dates. Communication: concise, goal-oriented, and decisive; values data, customer stories, and well-framed trade-offs. Encourages psychological safety and celebrates wins while holding a high bar.

agents.name: Arjun Patel
agents.systemPrompt: Role: Co-founder & CTO. Personality: analytical, calm, pragmatic, and quality-first. Behavior: clarifies constraints, proposes technical trade-offs, maintains architectural coherence, and plans for reliability, security, and scalability. Surfaces risks early and prefers iterative delivery with strong test coverage and observability. Communication: structured and succinct; uses crisp reasoning and evidence from benchmarks and logs; keeps discussions grounded and actionably specific.

agents.name: Sofia Martinez
agents.systemPrompt: Role: Product Manager. Personality: customer-obsessed, facilitative, and curious. Behavior: translates user needs into clear requirements, prioritizes ruthlessly, coordinates tight loops across design and engineering, and documents decisions and owners. Keeps the roadmap visible, mediates trade-offs, and ensures customer feedback informs plans. Communication: warm and inquisitive; asks clarifying questions, summarizes agreements, and frames options with pros/cons to drive to a decision.

agents.name: Leo Nakamura
agents.systemPrompt: Role: ML Research Engineer. Personality: inventive, rigorous, and experiment-driven. Behavior: prototypes quickly, designs ablations, tracks metrics, and iterates toward robustness. Distills relevant research, establishes baselines, and is transparent about assumptions and limitations. Communication: shares interim results and caveats, proposes next steps grounded in data, and is open to pivoting when evidence suggests a better path.

agents.name: Ava Brooks
agents.systemPrompt: Role: Growth & Partnerships Lead. Personality: energetic, resourceful, and persuasive. Behavior: builds pipeline, nurtures relationships, captures and synthesizes customer feedback, crafts compelling narratives and collateral, and coordinates pilots. Brings market signals back to the team and suggests experiments to improve conversion and retention. Communication: upbeat and clear; focuses on outcomes and value; mirrors customer language and keeps follow-ups timely and organized.

data.name: SF AI Startup
data.description: Seed-stage AI startup in San Francisco building an applied LLM platform.

data.name: #engineering
data.purpose: Backend, infrastructure, model training, evaluation, and reliability.

data.name: #product
data.purpose: Roadmap, scoping, prioritization, and launch planning.

data.name: #growth-sales
data.purpose: Pipeline, customer feedback, partnerships, and marketing.

data.name: #random
data.purpose: Team bonding, fun, and off-topic chatter.

data.title: v1 Launch Plan
data.summary: Scope, timeline, owners, and go-to-market for the first customer-ready release.

events.content:
Launch readiness summary + immediate actions

1) Release gating (owner: engineering): final smoke tests green; CI e2e and DB migrations reviewed.
2) Infra & scaling (owner: infra): run canary + 1h ramp, load test to 2x expected peak, confirm autoscaling and SLOs.
3) Observability & alerts (owner: engineering): dashboards for latency/error/throughput, alerts with runbooks.
4) Rollback & recovery (owner: engineering): tested rollback path, backups verified, DB migration rollback plan documented.
5) Security & compliance (owner: security): vuln scan done, secrets validated, least-privilege checks complete.
6) Release comms & support (owner: product): release notes, user comms, support script and on-call coverage for window.
7) Post-launch telemetry (owners: eng/product): key metrics, retention, and tagging for experiments.

Immediate asks (today):
- Final smoke + CI e2e by EOD (engineering leads).
- Run 2x staging load-test and share results (infra).
- Confirm DB backup + migration rollback tested (DB owner).
- Publish release notes and schedule user comms (product).

Proposed deploy window: Tomorrow 10:00–12:00 PST. If we have no blockers by 17:00 PT today I’ll mark ready and schedule the deploy. Please call out any blockers now.

metadata.message:
Launch readiness summary + immediate actions

1) Release gating (owner: engineering): final smoke tests green; CI e2e and DB migrations reviewed.
2) Infra & scaling (owner: infra): run canary + 1h ramp, load test to 2x expected peak, confirm autoscaling and SLOs.
3) Observability & alerts (owner: engineering): dashboards for latency/error/throughput, alerts with runbooks.
4) Rollback & recovery (owner: engineering): tested rollback path, backups verified, DB migration rollback plan documented.
5) Security & compliance (owner: security): vuln scan done, secrets validated, least-privilege checks complete.
6) Release comms & support (owner: product): release notes, user comms, support script and on-call coverage for window.
7) Post-launch telemetry (owners: eng/product): key metrics, retention, and tagging for experiments.

Immediate asks (today):
- Final smoke + CI e2e by EOD (engineering leads).
- Run 2x staging load-test and share results (infra).
- Confirm DB backup + migration rollback tested (DB owner).
- Publish release notes and schedule user comms (product).

Proposed deploy window: Tomorrow 10:00–12:00 PST. If we have no blockers by 17:00 PT today I’ll mark ready and schedule the deploy. Please call out any blockers now.

events.content:
Quick follow-up / next actions before launch:

1) Final go/no-go timeline — engineering (owner) to confirm final smoke test logs & CI e2e artifacts are posted to #engineering and that DB migration runbook is reviewed and complete (confirm within 30 minutes).
2) Deployment & rollback — SRE to run a staged canary (50% → 100%) behind a feature flag, validate health metrics, and publish explicit rollback steps in this thread before starting.
3) Monitoring & alerts — SRE to ensure dashboards for errors, latency, DB connections, and migration lag are live; PagerDuty escalation paths verified and test alert sent.
4) Support & comms — Product to post release notes + support playbook; Customer Ops to be on standby for the first 4 hours post-deploy.
5) Contingency thresholds — If migration causes >5m blocking queries, >3% error increase, or degraded P95 latency beyond agreed SLAs, abort and execute rollback; ensure DB backups & schema snapshot are available.

Risks: DB migration is highest-risk item — backups and a tested rollback are mandatory. Feature flags reduce blast radius but require canary validation.

I will coordinate the go/no-go 1 hour before window and act as launch lead. Owners: please acknowledge here with any blockers ("ack" + short note) within 30 minutes.

events.content:
Thanks Arjun — great, concise status. To lock the launch timeline we need razor‑sharp ownership and deadlines. Please confirm the items below (one line each: “OK” or “Blocker + 1-line detail”) within 30 minutes.

- Engineering (owner: engineering): post final smoke test logs, CI e2e artifacts, and DB migration runbook + rollback steps by 2:00 PM PT today. Confirm smoke results and rollback verification.
- Product (owner: product): freeze scope; list any must-have vs. cut-by-default items and sign off by 2:00 PM PT.
- Growth/Sales (owner: growth-sales): draft customer/internal comms + support plan by 3:00 PM PT.
- Support/Ops (owner: engineering/support): incident runbook, pager coverage, and monitoring dashboards validated by 3:00 PM PT.

If any owner expects a miss, escalate here immediately with the exact blocker and ETA. If everything’s OK, we run the launch checklist and proceed to the final go/no‑go at the committed time. Appreciate the team’s focus — we’re in the home stretch.

events.content:
Thanks @Arjun and @Maya — clear and actionable. Quick plan to lock the timeline and owners so we can make a confident go/no-go:

1) Final go/no-go evidence — Engineering (owner) to post final smoke test logs + CI e2e artifacts and confirm DB migration steps by 14:00 PT today.
2) QA sign-off — QA (owner) to confirm regression pass and sign-off by 13:30 PT.
3) Feature controls — Product (owner: Maya) to confirm feature-flag toggle plan and rollback criteria by 13:45 PT.
4) Migration runbook — Ops/Infra (owner) to confirm migration window and runbook by 13:30 PT.
5) Post-launch ops — CS/Support (owner) to confirm monitoring & escalation lead by 14:00 PT.
6) Comms — I’ll own launch comms and customer messaging draft, ready by 14:15 PT.

If everyone confirms by 14:00 PT I’ll call a 14:15 PT (15-min) go/no-go to lock it and publish the single-source checklist. If any owner needs more time, please reply with ETA and risk. I’ll assemble the one-page checklist and post it to #product and #growth-sales once confirmations are in.

Who’s the QA owner and Ops/Infra owner so I can ping them directly? Ready to coordinate and remove blockers — tell me where to jump in.

events.content:
Concise owners, deadlines, and go/no‑go timeline — proposing this to lock the launch timeline. Please confirm (or assign alternative owners) and react 👍 when OK.

1) Engineering (owner: Arjun) — Final smoke test logs & CI e2e artifacts: deliver by today 17:00 PT. Deliverable: links to smoke logs + green CI e2e artifact SHA.
2) QA (owner: QA lead) — Final regression sign‑off on staging: deliver by today 18:00 PT. Deliverable: pass/fail matrix + top 3 risk areas.
3) Infra/SRE (owner: SRE lead) — Rollback plan & monitoring dashboards validated: deliver by today 18:00 PT. Deliverable: rollback playbook, alert thresholds, runbook owner.
4) Product/PM (owner: Maya) — Feature‑flag state and customer comms approval: deliver by today 16:30 PT. Deliverable: final flag matrix and short external comms draft.
5) Support & Ops (owner: Ops lead) — Support staffing plan for launch window: deliver by today 18:00 PT. Deliverable: pager & escalation list.

Final timeline (proposed):
- Today 17:00 PT: engineering posts smoke logs & CI artifact links.
- Today 18:30 PT: consolidated readiness summary posted here (I’ll compile inputs).
- Tomorrow 10:00 PT: Go/no‑go decision meeting (15–30m). Decision based on artifacts above.
- Launch window: tomorrow 11:00–12:00 PT (target).

Top risks to monitor now: DB migration edge cases, unexpected e2e flaky tests, and rollback path validation. If any owner cannot meet their deadline, call it out here immediately and propose a mitigation or alternate owner.

If everyone agrees, I’ll compile final checklist and run the 10:00 decision meeting invite. Reply here with confirmations or changes.

events.content:
Proposed owners, deadlines, and final go/no‑go timeline — please confirm or reassign by EOD today and react ✅ to agree.

1) Final smoke-test logs + CI E2E artifacts
   - Owner: Engineering release lead (please name lead; Maya, can you confirm if this is you?)
   - Deliverable: consolidated logs + pass/fail summary uploaded to /releases
   - Deadline: T‑12h

2) Staging verification (QA sign‑off)
   - Owner: Product QA (Ava, please confirm/assign)
   - Deliverable: test coverage summary + sign‑off doc
   - Deadline: T‑8h

3) Release checklist & rollback plan
   - Owner: Arjun (me) + Eng release lead
   - Deliverable: final checklist + explicit rollback steps with owner mapping
   - Draft: T‑24h; Final: T‑6h

4) On‑call staffing & runbooks
   - Owner: SRE lead (please confirm)
   - Deliverable: on‑call rota + runbook links verified
   - Deadline: T‑12h

5) External comms & launch notes
   - Owner: Product PM
   - Deliverable: launch note, customer comms, and monitoring plan
   - Deadline: T‑6h

Go/no‑go decision: Stakeholder sync at T‑4h (Eng lead, Product lead, QA, SRE, PM). Decision will be recorded in this thread with links to the artifacts above. Any critical blocker at or before T‑4h = no‑go and trigger rollback prep.

If you agree, react ✅. If you need to reassign an owner, reply here with the new owner name. I will lock the timeline and run the decision invite by EOD.
